title: Worlds Bot lane advantage winrate. 100%
body:
So far. am going to keep up with Statistics because this is funny. this is beyond funny. mid, top, don't matter at all. jungle matters slightly

can we please keep the camera on bot lane the entire game

**btw. am not lying. you can look up every single game in worlds so far. and watch the scores gold and items and damage dealt. not a single time did the better performing bot lane lose a game. and top or mid. doesn't matter. they lose when ahead sometimes. they are dependant variables. **

replies.body:
This is the stupidest thread I have ever seen.

No shit the winning team, AT THE END OF THE GAME, will have a more fed ADC.

Whereas in G2 vs SUP just THIS MORNING, Zeitnot CRUSHED bot lane, and massively overperformed Hjarnan in teamfights and they still lost the game.

Or when EDG iBoy MASSIVELY outperformed INF's bot lane, but STILL lost because he got 1 shot by enemy 0/4 Irelia every teamfight. Neat. 

Every actual analyst says mid/jungle duo is the most important this worlds - but Silver/Bronze analysts on boards hiding behind second accounts think differently I guess.

no he fucking didn't. they were even on cs. also a support main. who woulda thunk

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8sA-WSrkm-c

this is the game. being a kill up but being cs behind doesn't mean you won bot. he didn't. and the adc carried the game on enemy team

At 13:34 SUP Zeitnot takes out G2s bot turret and is 1/0/2 136 cs to G2 Hjarnan's 1/1/0 123 cs (SUP turret is at 75% at this point). 

At that same point in the game in mid GBM is 0/1/1 106 cs to Perkz  is 1/0/0 140 cs.

How in the world are you evaluating lane advantages when you're looking at these games?

Side note: The fact that Charge Attack is a support main has literally nothing to do with the fact he provided an example that disproves your analysis, ad hominems do nothing to further a discussion.
{{summoner:11}}
clean{{sticker:sg-zephyr}}

In comes Maple with the knowledge bomb. Thanks for telling this "smurf" what is true in the matter. Some people in this world just, post before thinking, and don't expect anything from it. Keep up the good work.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot MapleNectar,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=N44WE58e,comment-id=000500000001,timestamp=2018-10-04T17:01:09.226+0000)
>
> At 13:34 SUP Zeitnot takes out G2s bot turret and is 1/0/2 136 cs to G2 Hjarnan's 1/1/0 123 cs (SUP turret is at 75% at this point). 

how the hell is top supposed to be faster at taking out his opponents turret, when there isnt a fortification buff on the bot lane turret, and there are 2 people+ down there?

an early won fight in the bot lane vs a won fight in the top lane in comparison.

you have 1 to 2 people pushing against a fortified turret top, or 3 people pushing against a non fortified turret on bot lane assuming jungle assistance in both cases.

even without champion gold, this means turret first blood bonus goes to bot lane almost all of the time.

so of course bot is going to have a massive lead very fast, if you engineer it as such.

dont talk as if this was a fault of the players. in fact, both bot and top probably had similar chances to apply turret pressure and the difference is just a result of your games mechanics. 

shits rigged.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot MapleNectar,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=N44WE58e,comment-id=000500000001,timestamp=2018-10-04T17:01:09.226+0000)
>
> At 13:34 SUP Zeitnot takes out G2s bot turret and is 1/0/2 136 cs to G2 Hjarnan's 1/1/0 123 cs (SUP turret is at 75% at this point). 
> 
> At that same point in the game in mid GBM is 0/1/1 106 cs to Perkz  is 1/0/0 140 cs.
> 
> How in the world are you evaluating lane advantages when you're looking at these games?
> 
> Side note: The fact that Charge Attack is a support main has literally nothing to do with the fact he provided an example that disproves your analysis, ad hominems do nothing to further a discussion.

Layman's terms for the win.

> [{quoted}](name=charge attack,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=N44WE58e,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2018-10-04T15:04:20.881+0000)
>
> This is the stupidest thread I have ever seen.
> 
> No shit the winning team, AT THE END OF THE GAME, will have a more fed ADC.
> 
> Whereas in G2 vs SUP just THIS MORNING, Zeitnot CRUSHED bot lane, and massively overperformed Hjarnan in teamfights and they still lost the game.
> 
> Or when EDG iBoy MASSIVELY outperformed INF's bot lane, but STILL lost because he got 1 shot by enemy 0/4 Irelia every teamfight. Neat. 
> 
> Every actual analyst says mid/jungle duo is the most important this worlds - but Silver/Bronze analysts on boards hiding behind second accounts think differently I guess.

He's not saying the end of the game tho. Hes saying check whose ahead in bot lane at like 15 min and so far you can call 100% of the games off that and nothing else. Seems a bit suspicious....
Then he’s wrong. Because you can’t do that.
well tbh Id say mid/jg is only so important because they can move and win bot for their team (while getting scuttles and other objectives) lol

And how many times did the better performing bot lane have the jungle pressure applied first? 

40% of your team is in the lane closest to dragon and with the weakest tower; of course it will draw the attention of another 20% of your team to make the total percentage of players in that area come out to 60%. 

Why would this lane not be the most important? ._. It literally doesn't even matter which champions are in it; just that 60% of the entire team is focused in that one part of the map. 

When mid and top being ahead suddenly means that the other three players being behind doesn't matter is the day I will literally quit this game. Because that would be literal bullshit.

EDIT: That feel when salty people who dont like the truth of the matter downvote you. Lol okay. Doesn't matter if you down vote me; 60% is bigger than 40% and three players is more than two. Two champions should *not* be able to solo carry a game if three of the enemy team's players are fed, strong, and well farmed. I'm sorry that this doesn't fit your special snowflake mentality.

Worth mentioning that many midlaners like to roam botlane too, so basically basically 80% of all players in a match will visit botlane even as early as during laning phase.

And people wonder why the botlane that gets ahead tends to win when spoonfed kills and assists in such a manner? x)

Pretty much. ._. Its the lane with the most objectives near it and two people. It just makes sense for a jungler and the midlane to be there. I wish they'd find a way to change it so ADC and Support when top instead of bot. I'd personally love it if bot lane was a 2v2 again instead of a 2v3 or 2v4.

Actually that is a interesting idea?

Or rather, move the dragon topside.

Dragon is a super powerful objective depending on circumstance or if your team just manage to grab a few in a row, having such a thing near botlane just promotes early aggression and roaming endlessly, so why not just switch dragon and herald around until baron spawns?

That makes toplane more important and gives botlane some peace to just farm, a jungler who secures his team a double botlane wont have a 100% free dragon ontop of it.

That would just make top the new bot, ADC+Support follow the dragon because they're the most effective lane to take it with the jungler after a successful gank.

What would be interesting is if top got the first single scuttlecrab guaranteed, that would give them a lot more influence over the jungle's matchup which in turn effects the entire map.

This isn't quite true; Season 5 Worlds was the Worlds of Lane Swapping. It wasn't uncommon for bot lane to go top instead of going bot. The reason that bot lane turret is like it is now is specifically to prevent lane swaps in pro play. Yet another change made specifically for the balance of pro play that did nothing to actually help soloqueue. 

If they moved dragon top and put Rift Scuttler bot lane where dragon usually goes and kept the weaker tower, I would be interested to see how *that* affected things.

and then there's this {{summoner:12}}  , which is never overpowered unless it's a tank meta or the towers are weak unless Riot says so

so basically 100% of players can focus bottom lane compared to 60% for top and 60% for mid, though nothing stops bot from roaming mid so you could also say that mid can have 100% pressure and is the shortest lane

That's nto how a fucking moba works for fuck sake. 
This is the entire fuckin problem with this game and why it's so shit.
This isn't kindergarden level math game. 

A lategame hypercarry and a support who share resources together are from the moment the game starts worth more/stronger/ whatever than a solo laner mage or bruiser? 
What is THIS bullshit supposed to be?
So why even play a solo lane? Btw the hardest aspect of the game. 
Why should a jungler who doesn't have to do anything anymore have more impact and equal resources? 
ADC the same shit why should a LATEGAME HYPERCARRY be on par of a solo laner? Just why? 

Gimme back the old game where a fed renekton top took over the game because we decided to draft a full lategame teamcomp. 
It's easier to shut this one renekton down than lategame hypercarry that hypercarries from berserker greaves and a support that is better than anyone else. 
But ofc the trashbags like the current gamestate more. You have to do less to achieve more. 
I don't even need to look you up to know you are a rightclick main who thinks he should have the same impact as a ranged lategame carry as an early game mage or bruiser. 

The only reason midlaners so far don't complain as much as top is becuse they can still influence the map by the position of their lane. 

But whatever let's enjoy another season of: oh they picked kaisa/nami guess the game is over. 
Or: oh the lee sin who doesn't have to farm or invade or literally do anything else sat an entire wave in the brush so im behind and lost lane haHAAA fun game.


Small Edit: 
Because i KNOW people will come "but but dRaGon Is tHeRe" noone gives a shit. 
They don't get botlane ahead because of dragon. They get botlane ahead because they literally take over the game 10 minutes into the match. 
You can easily give away a dragon for getting toplane ahead IF IT WOULD MATTER but IT DOESN'T. 
Shitty overpriced items, tanks overpowered as hell, botlane overpowered. 
There is no reason to get your solo lanes ahead. Mid only matters to make them roam to get BOT ahead.

What resource outside of EXP do a support and ADC share? Not farm; the support has a gold gen item and the ADC takes the farm. Not agency because the support has all of that. Not buffs; ADC is the only one who gets red buff and that's late game. 

These are two who champions that literally only share a lane and EXP. Of course two should be stronger than one. The fact that you expect a bruiser, mage, or assassin to just magically be able to 2v1 because the two people that they're 2v1'ing happen to be sharing a lane is ludicrous and ththe real issue with this game. There are more things to champions than their gold, items and experience; they actually kits that actually do things separate from nearly all of that. 

So yes. Two champions should inherently be stronger and more important than one bruiser, mage, or assassin. It *is* actually basic level kindergarten math. I'm sorry you failed.

Also, yes it does matter if your bot lane is stronger when it comes to dragon. You dont want to end up on a 3v3 where the odds are stacked against you because your ADC only has half an item and theirs has an item and a half. Again, this is basic kindergarten math.

"I'm sorry that this doesn't fit your special snowflake mentality."

DON'T WORRY RIOT-KUN I'LL PROTECT YOU
Other lanes mattering was fun while it lasted I guess...
2/5ths of your team is more important than 1/5th. In other news, water is wet.
So wait, if top mid and jungle are doing well but bot is behind, tough shit 40% > 60%?

If bot isnt doing well, jungle likely isnt either because dragon is controlled via bot side, so no, its not 60<40 as you claim.

Mid is also likely behind, because theyre gank heavy.

If that's actually the case, the 60% will matter more than the 40%.

However, as Pika said, botlane pressure is usually necessary for a drake. If botlane is behind, it also means that their mid wasn't roaming bot, and the winning botside's mid *was*, because botlane is the easiest gank for a midlaner.

If botlane's behind, four people aren't doing their jobs properly. Mid isn't roaming for more gold, jungle isn't ganking and isn't getting drake because of the lost botlane, and the actual botlane itself is losing. If mid or top is behind, it's only on two people.
There is an uncomfortable amount of people who will insist that water is not wet. Lol.

> [{quoted}](name=ßlended Fetus,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=N44WE58e,comment-id=00020001,timestamp=2018-10-04T15:43:04.432+0000)
>
> There is an uncomfortable amount of people who will insist that water is not wet. Lol.

Technically isn't something being "wet" when it has water on it?  So by default water is just water, and not itself being wet.
By definition, it can have a liquid on it, or be a liquid itself.  Water is a liquid; therefore it is wet.

> [{quoted}](name=ßlended Fetus,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=N44WE58e,comment-id=0002000100010000,timestamp=2018-10-05T18:50:35.781+0000)
>
> By definition, it can have a liquid on it, or be a liquid itself.  Water is a liquid; therefore it is wet.

Honestly the answer really depends on how deep down the chemistry rabbit hole you want to go.
I guess.  I had a coworker try to dispute that water was not a liquid - therefore not wet.  I'm not sure if water "not being a liquid" can be corroborated via chemistry - I'm not a chemist. Lol.

ADCs are the cancer of this game.

EDIT: lul getting downvoted by Stormrazor abusers.
it's actually the supports, i wish supports didn't exist

> [{quoted}](name=crispy66,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=N44WE58e,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2018-10-04T15:11:38.104+0000)
>
> it's actually the supports, i wish supports didn't exist

I wish supports, supported the whole team.  The two-headed monster bot has distorted the game forever.

I mean they already support the team, with wards, and being with the team in general. 

Oh someone is killing my teammate I better heal him!

Because the route your are going down, is more along the lines of, "oh someone is killing my mid laner in the river, I am pushed... Yeah fuck em gotta protect my adc from dying."

Supports will always support the whole team, whoever needs aids and the support is near by. Where does the support go? To the teammate that needs them. Jesus you people are bias.
If a team's mid and jungle play well, they must have helped bot a lot. That is what you want to say

> [{quoted}](name=UVM ZhaoRiTian,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=N44WE58e,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2018-10-04T14:43:17.568+0000)
>
> If a team's mid and jungle play well, they must have helped bot a lot. That is what you want to say

So basically bot is so much more important that the only way for the other lanes to preform is to suck the ADCs dick all game?

In proplay its the bot lane. But for gold/platinum/diamond, jungle is daddy and mid is mommy. Top/sup/adc should be their adopted child doing cheap labor for them. Eventually in late game they may offer some leftovers for adc.  For silver/bronze, everyone has an equal chance to be a star (excluding the inferior sup) while the other 4 are just orphans.

> [{quoted}](name=UVM ZhaoRiTian,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=N44WE58e,comment-id=000400010000,timestamp=2018-10-04T17:37:28.868+0000)
>
> In proplay its the bot lane. But for gold/platinum/diamond, jungle is daddy and mid is mommy. Top/sup/adc should be their adopted child doing cheap labor for them. Eventually late they must give some leftovers for adc.  For silver/bronze, everyone has an equal chance to be a star (excluding the inferior sup) while the other 4 are just orphans.

Not even fucking close Mid>ADC>TOP>Graves/Taliyah>SUP>>>>>>>> JUNGLE
the only match where jungle does not deserve to be taken care of by his teammates is in which if he play {{champion:33}} . other tank jungle are underperforming and shouldn't be picked.
This is not true. Jungle/Mid is undeniably the most important positions.
Not really, G2 botlane fell behind almost every game especially against supermassive, the only difference : jungle/mid roaming and helping them..
Why is this bias garbage post on the front page.. oh wait I forgot the boards are bias.
Literally anything that hates on ADCs will make front page. Doesn't matter if it's blatantly false with 0 substance, the mindless ADC-hating drones will upvote it.

for those disagreeing with me. fine its fine to disagree. but we've had over 25 games so far. not a single fucking game did the behind bot lane lose

no. being 5 cs behind in lane doesn't mean your losing lane. it means your even. and don't fucking lie to my face when you sau "OH ZEITNOT SMASHED bot"

when he didn't.

> [{quoted}](name=RankOneWakanda,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=N44WE58e,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2018-10-04T15:15:01.008+0000)
>
> for those disagreeing with me. fine its fine to disagree. but we've had over 25 games so far. not a single fucking game did the behind bot lane lose
> 
> no. being 5 cs behind in lane doesn't mean your losing lane. it means your even. and don't fucking lie to my face when you sau "OH ZEITNOT SMASHED bot"
> 
> when he didn't.

I get the frustration but I'm sorry the fact that there being 4 people in one lane should mean they matter more. "So if bot loses its gg" Well yes since that's 2 of your 5 players. Same should happen if your bot does well but the rest of your map doesn't they lose. (which if you look at that statistic from worlds is also 100% true)

Hell  you can see that in soloqueue. I cant tell you how many times I've been part of a bot lane that won hard but consequently turned around and didnt win the game because I just cant carry three other players failing.
I can guarantee you fed botlane losing is entirely the botlanes fault because they don't know how to play the game.

That had nothing to do with my statement. You already proved you can't do basic kindergarten math. Now you can't do basic kindergarten reading. I stated that my bot lane *won* lane and still lost because Mid/Top/Jungle decided to open up a soup kitchen to solve world hunger.
Just ignore that person. He is incredibly biased and anti-ADC. He lives for threads like these so he can bash ADC.
